name: Gigi Gringold
description:
Looking for a sweet compact girl who can play with the best of them AND snuggle when it's time?  Then maybe Gigi is the girl for you!

Gigi is a 3 year old American Staffordshire Terrier/American Bulldog mix (it's what her DNA test said!). She was originally rescued with her puppies from a high kill shelter.  Her puppies were adopted right away and now it's Gigi's turn at forever happiness.  Gigi is a solid girl and loves to play hard with other dogs.  In fact, Gigi is happiest when she has other dogs around for her to interact with. She's been going to doggie daycare and loves it!  She would be best in a home where she has other dogs who want to play. 

It can sometimes take Gigi a little time to warm up to new people but once she does, she is sweet as sugar.  She has an adorable wiggle-butt and, at 40 lbs, she's a good snuggling and lap dog size.  Gigi gets nervous around kids so she'd be better off where there are only older children. 
Name: Gigi Gringold
Breed:  Staffordshire Terrier/American Bulldog mix  
Sex: Female
Age: 3 years old
Weight: 40 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Children: Children make Gigi nervous - (i.e. toddlers etc); older children should be fine.
Good with Dogs: Yes- does daycare at Gagnon's
Good with Cats: No

Adoption Donation: $250.00

IMPORTANT INFORMATION:
Interested in a specific dog, please fill out an application if you are interested in a dog. The number of individual inquiries is overwhelming and we are finding it difficult to respond to each one. We cannot guarantee you will receive a timely response.

Paws New England is a rescue, not a shelter, and as such we do not have our dogs housed in one location - they are in foster homes both in New England and in our southern foster homes.   If you're interested in a specific dog, please complete a short online application and you will receive a reply within 48 hours so you can ask questions.

At present, if a dog is listed on our website, the dog is considered still available HOWEVER, may have applications that have come in before yours but it's still too early to know if any are a good match; therefore we encourage you to apply.


NOTICE WITH REGARD TO LOCATION OF DOGS:  Please note: Paws New England is a foster-based rescue. We do not have a brick and mortar building to house the dogs we rescue. We have found that dogs in foster homes are much more adoptable because they have been observed in a home setting. Dogs listed with Paws New England typically reside in various locations throughout the south (primarily Tennessee, Texas, and Arkansas) and New England (not necessarily in the state of Rhode Island). You will be notified by the adoption coordinator of the location of the dog you are interested in so you have the ability to decide whether to pursue adoption or not.

Dogs transported to New England are done so at a fee of $150.00 paid directly to the transporting company by Paws New England; no additional transport costs are responsibility of adopter. This fee is included in the adoption donation.

Adoption donations cover pre-adoption vet costs (including vaccinations, spay/neuter when age appropriate, and heartworm testing/treatment when necessary), a microchip, and transportation to New England if necessary.

Donations for our young, healthy puppies and dogs support their fellow canines of advanced age or suffering from injuries and abuse whose donations are reduced but whose veterinary costs are typically much higher. We appreciate your understanding that your dog will help others in need.

All known information about the animal is listed above. We do our best to give accurate information, but most of our dogs are rescues and do not come with a known history.

Paws New England abides by the dog importation regulations set forth in the states of MA, CT, NH and RI.

name: Nugget
description:
Nugget is a gorgeous 2 year old. He has stunning looks and a great personality which explains his start to life. Nugget and his baby mamma lived as strays for over a year, that we know of, and had 2 litters of puppies, one of which was the Highlanders pups rescued by PAWS late this summer! They were caught and he is now looking for his forever home! 

He is an all around great dog and is a huge love bug!  He walks well on a leash and is working hard on basic obedience training He was temperament tested by a professional trainer and he passed with flying colors!  He gives the sweetest, most gentle hugs ever!

Nugget is truly an amazing dog and deserves an amazing home! Could that be you?!


Name: Nugget
Sex: Male
Breed:  Golden Mix
Age:  2 years as of 11/16/18
Weight: 60 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes 
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Will be before adoption


BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Dogs:  Yes, with proper introductions. 
Cats: No
Kids: Yes- he does well with children

description:
Gary is a stunning 7 month old shepherd mix. He was surrendered to PAWS as his owners could not handle the energy of an active puppy! Gary is a typical 7 month old who still has lots of puppy energy. He needs a family committed to basic obedience training and has the energy for a puppy! 

Gary does GREAT with other dogs! He is very sweet and gets along well with all people! If you want a great dog- Gary is your guy!

description:

Very attentive and does well with obedience .she would do best in a home with mellow dogs. She doesn’t like hyper or young dogs. Very smart and easily trainable 

Abbie is new to her foster home so we''ll update as time goes on but be sue to not miss out!!!

name: Gus Aruba
description:
This handsome guy with a wonderful black shiny cot is GUS - note he looks quite comfy in the snow which is odd as he just arrived from Aruba - I'm sure he's not quite sure what that white stuff is but he's sure enjoying it.

As you can see, this guy has a good energy level  - here he is with Stevie, one of our other new citizens of the USA - they are having a blast running around and both really enjoy the company of other dogs.   https://youtu.be/GVpwd57-m3A

Here's an adorable video of Gus and Abbie, his other foster sibling.
https://youtu.be/NUoNWJ1s_pI

Gus is approximately 4 years old - very very sweet and affectionate with humans and canines alike.  He's unknown with cats.

He is a larger cocker spaniel mix found as a stray on the beautiful island of Aruba  ! Very sweet and affectionate, he likes to play with other dogs as well as with toys. He is fearful of very large male dogs. Gus is approximately 35 lbs. he is up to date on all shots and is housetrained. Unknown with cats. He’s a very handsome and quiet boy. His activity level is moderate. 

Name: Gus Aruba
Breed: Spaniel/Crossbreed
Sex: Male
Age: 4 years 0 months
Weight: 35 lbs.
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:

Good with Dogs:  Yes, another dog is almost a requirement

name: Bailey Wiggle Butt
description:
After reading about Bailey you'd like more info, please email: joannepawsne@gmail.com


Bailey WB  - an adorable medium sized brindle wiggle butt - that's what he is!!  He had an adorable nub tail that he wiggles whenever you even look at him.

Bailey is local living in Massachusetts in a Paws NE Foster home after Thanksgiving and we'll be hoping to have people lined up to meet him!!

This cutie comes to us via his family who are unable to care for him any longer and reached out for help - these are great people who love Bailey and realize he needs more than they are able to give him right now.  He loves human affection more than anything in the world (face licker).  

Bailey does great in doggie daycare and is really good with other dogs - we think another dog in his new home would be ideal for him.  He has a little confidence building to do as he gets nervous on leash when stranger approach.  A confident dog would teach him that humans are good to have around.

Bailey is housetrained - he's not a big fan of crates but he doesn't really need one.

Super active - a hiker and someone on the go where he could tag along would be fantastic.  

Name: Bailey Wiggle Butt
Breed: Boston Terrier/Rat Terrier
Sex: Unknown
Age: 2 years 2 months
Weight: 20.0
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to l date
Heartworm:  Negative
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children:  Not tested
Good with Dogs:  Yes
Good with Cats:   Not tested - does great with big humans.

name: Shell
description:
November is adopt a senior month, and we have the senior for you!! 

Shell is a fun little guy.  He walks well on a leash and does his business the minute you take him out.  He will jump in your lap for attention.  Shell likes to run, jump, and play.  Shell can co-exist with other dogs as long as he gets to be the boss.  He does best with larger, submissive dogs. He is travel-sized and willing to follow you anywhere.  Shell was surrendered with Marley when their owner passed away.  They can be separated and are not housed together.

If you are ready to open your heart to a sweet senior he will return that with lots of loyalty and love!

name: Gail
description:
Gail is tha bomb!!!!!!!!!  

She is amazing and is used as the dog tester at the shelter because she is that good!  She does great with every single dog we put her with.  She loves her friends and her toys. She plays with calm and rowdy dogs. She is good at reading their play styles and matches it.  

She has a lot of energy so an active family would be great. Once she is done playing, she will come to you for attention and love. She does pull on a leash because she is so happy and excited to see everything and meet everyone and will benefit from continued leash training.  She is a smart well-adjusted girl!

The family that gets Gail willl be very lucky!

Weight: 38 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Yes

name: Stevie Ruba
description:
**Fostering in New England**

Hello New Englanders,

We are pleased to introduce you to Stevie. Stevie is a sweet-as-pie, 9-month rescue straight off the island of Aruba! We believe this cutie is a Whippet/Hound mix. Gosh is it a cute combo, wouldn't you say?

Trust us when we tell you how surprised Stevie was after leaving sunshiny Aruba to land here in New England just in time for the first snow fall. After a few frolics in the snow, we are pretty sure Stevie is okay with the, eh, colder conditions. Especially when he has a jacket on and playmate in the yard... The prospect of a new, loving forever home is worth all the snow in the world to this guy! Could that forever home be with you?

As Stevie was a stray in Aruba, he is a bit on the shy side. Living with humans is new to him. However, like the snow, it's a new thing that he is finding he absolutely adores. Once he is given a moment to get grounded, this little guy wants nothing more than to be loved by people. He loves getting neck and belly rubs and giving his people kisses to let them know he loves and appreciates them. 

Stevie could be described as medium energy. When he is in the house, he is quite calm. He's content to lay down with a bone or play quietly with a tennis ball. However, he does have some playful energy about him. We've found that he really likes to get outdoors and adventure. Do you have a nice fenced in area for him to run? Do you like long walks? Maybe a weekend hike? Wow, Stevie is THRILLED at the prospect of all of the above. He would be so happy to have a human (or a family of humans) to go adventuring with!

We've found that Stevie really thrives when he is around other dogs. We do think he could be an only dog. However, he seems happiest when he has a buddy around to play with! He also gets a little confidence from other dogs. For instance, he is working on his leash walking outside. When we go on walks alone, he seems a little unsure. When we go on walks with his foster brothers, he is ALL in! Sniffing and exploring the neighborhood like a pro! 

We so hope you will consider adopting Stevie. We feel strongly that this sweet soul is sure to bring abundant happiness into your life! 

 

Name: Stevie Ruba
Breed:  Whippet/Hound mix
Sex: Male
Age: 9 months
Weight: 32 lbs
Spayed/Neutered:   Neutered
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Too young to test.
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes
Good with Dogs: Yes (loves other dogs of all sizes)
Good with Cats: Unknown

name: Vicky Aruba
description:
Meet one of our newest citizens of the USA from Aruba - handsome Vicky was rescued along with her brother Victor Aruba from  the Aruba Animal Shelter and sponsored by the Animal Relief Foundation - Aruba.

An adorable little girl who is very new to us so we'll have to update this bio as soon as possible  -  he's currently fostering in northern Connecticut and is doing great - total puppy action.

It's difficult to determine how big he will get but we think medium size pup - however no guarantees on size estimates!!!!  

So far she seems quite inquisitive and doing well with the other dogs in the home!  She's seems a little bigger than some of the other pups in the group - she may be a medium/large girl by the time she's done! (Decent size paws)

Here's a video of she and her brother Victor upon meeting the group at her foster mom's daycare business - as you can see - she's very inquisitive - she fit right in and had fun right away.  Her brother was a little more shy.
https://youtu.be/Mwwd0sYP93E

More info forthcoming!!!  And pictures too.

name: Hazel Ann
description:
Hazel Ann is a stunningly gorgeous lab mix. She was found in a rural area as a puppy. She likes toys, bones, cuddles, treats, inside living, and outside living.  She doesn't care much for loud noises, or going into a kennel but once in the kennel she is good and will lay down and sleep.  She smiles when she gets excited- it is so cute! 

She knows how to sit, stay, outside go potty, and to be gentle. She could work on being retrained to enter a kennel. She is really good behavior wise. She loves being around kids from infants to teens - she has been living in a home with an infant, a toddler, and a teen. She has been around kids since she was 8 weeks old. She loves other dogs as well, from old to young from small to large, both male and female dogs. She is okay with cats she likes to sniff them a lot which they may not like. 

Hazel truly is an all around outstanding dog! Consider adding her to your home! 


Name: Hazel Ann 
Sex: Female
Breed: Lab mix
Age: 6 months old as of 11/11/18
Weight: 45 pounds as of 11/11/18

name: Clara Belle
description:
Playful?  Fun?  Quiet?  Smart?  Loving?  If that sounds amazing than look no further because Clara Belle is your lady!  She is all of those things and so much more. She is a 2 year old Shepard/Chow mix who gets along great with her doggy friends and adores people. She lived with a family and four other dogs before, but one of those dogs was a rowdy, rambunctious puppy that drove Clara Belle crazy. Unfortunately, Clara Belle and the puppy got into a couple of arguments and the family was afraid things would only get worse. She was well loved but the newest to the household, so she is seeking her own home now. She is housebroken, crate trained, leash trained and simply wonderful. She loves hugs and soft blankies on cold nights. Do you have a soft place for this very sweet girl to place her head at night?

Breed: Shep/Chow mix

name: Scooby Shiba
description:
Scooby dooby doo where are you?! Are you looking for an amazing dog?! Then look no farther! 

Scooby is an adorable 5-6 year old Shiba Inu, Chi mix. He is was found as a stray and now is looking for his forever home. He is a bit timid at first but once he warms up to someone he is very loyal and loving. He loves going on walks, going on car rides, and being around his people. Scooby does the cutest thing where he will run sometimes and it looks like he is hopping like a bunny! 

A quiet, loving home would be ideal for Scooby! If you think you could be the perfect home for Scooby, apply today!!

Sex: Male

name: Sir Leonard
description:
Meet Leonard aka Lennie!

He is an adorable young man. He is very loving and very loyal to his human. His favorite pastime is to curl up beside you on the couch. He is fearless!!  He does love every dog and cat and is very submissive towards them unless they get close to his human on the couch! He is crate trained and almost completely house trained. At night he will sleep under the cover with you as he is always cold. 

He is really a very special sweet loving boy with a few chihuahua quirks!! An ideal home would be one with no children or grandchildren under 10 that can give him lots of love and attention!

Name: Sir Leonard
Breed: Chihuahua Mix 
Sex: Male
Age: 2 years old
Weight: 7 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:

name: Ginger Spice
description:
Spice up your life- with Ginger Spice!! Ginger is fostering in New England! 

Ginger Spice is one of the litter of the Spice Girls that were born in a lady’s pasture after their mom (a 15 lb terrier) had been dumped in the country. Luckily the lady found the mom in time to be able to care for her and her babies.  It appears that dad was a chihuahua just based on the puppies’ looks.  She has had a not so ideal beginning, but this is now all behind her. She is a little skiddish, and can be afraid of a hand and would back up. She adapts very quickly and learns to trust, within a day she knew what “pick up” means. 

She is submissive, always on the move, loves her toys, even the big ones, and loves to romp around with her foster sibblings. She is not a typical Chihuahua, as she is not high strung or a barker, just a puppy who needs to be trained. Housebreaking is in process, and she walks on the leash, but stays very close to the feet at this time.  The ideal home would be one with lots of love and attention. She seems to be used to table food, and jumps on your lap to get to the human food.  

Ginger Spice needs to regain her girly puppy figure with some high quality nutrition and exercise. While she does not go in her crate voluntarily, once she is in, she is all good and she settles in. She will be an awesome little dog with time and patience to train to good house manners. Because of her tiny size, a home with no young children would be best, but she would love another doggie friend to play with.

Name: Ginger Spice
Sex: Female
Breed: Chihuahua/small terrier mix
Age: Date of birth 5/4/18
Weight: 9 pounds on 11/8/18
Spayed/Neutered: Will be spayed before adoption.
Vaccinations: Up to date in the puppy series. May require additional vaccinations post adoption at expense of adopter.
Heartworm: Too young to test, on preventative.
Microchipped: Yes

IMPORTANT INFORMATION:
Interested in a specific dog, please fill out an application if you are interested in a dog. The number of individual inquiries is overwhelming and we are finding it difficult to respond to each one. We cannot guarantee you will receive a timely response.

Paws New England is a rescue, not a shelter, and as such we do not have our dogs housed in one location - they are in foster homes both in New England and in our southern foster homes.   If you're interested in a specific dog, please complete a short online application and you will receive a reply within 48 hours so you can ask questions.

At present, if a dog is listed on our website, the dog is considered still available HOWEVER, may have applications that have come in before yours but it's still too early to know if any are a good match; therefore we encourage you to apply.

We have found that dogs in foster homes are much more adoptable because they have been observed in a home setting. Dogs listed with Paws New England typically reside in various locations throughout the south (primarily Tennessee, Texas, and Arkansas) and New England (not necessarily in the state of Rhode Island). You will be notified by the adoption coordinator of the location of the dog you are interested in so you have the ability to decide whether to pursue adoption or not.

Dogs transported to New England are done so at a fee of $150.00 paid directly to the transporting company by Paws New England; no additional transport costs are responsibility of adopter. This fee is included in the adoption donation.

Adoption donations cover pre-adoption vet costs (including vaccinations, spay/neuter when age appropriate, and heartworm testing/treatment when necessary), a microchip, and transportation to New England if necessary.

Donations for our young, healthy puppies and dogs support their fellow canines of advanced age or suffering from injuries and abuse whose donations are reduced but whose veterinary costs are typically much higher. We appreciate your understanding that your dog will help others in need.

All known information about the animal is listed above. We do our best to give accurate information, but most of our dogs are rescues and do not come with a known history.

Paws New England abides by the dog importation regulations set forth in the states of MA, CT, NH and RI.

- Cannot wait for her forever home!

name: Nicole Reid
description:
Norris and Nicole Reid are fully vetted and ready to find their forever homes! This duo is fun-loving and can’t wait to each have a family of their own. Norris is the social butterfly, whereas Nicole is a little more shy. These two love other dogs and play very well with their canine friends. They are expected to do well with cats based on their personalities. As medium-energy pups, Norris and Nicole should also be a good fit for a family with or without kids. Both Norris and Nicole are hoping for families who can be dedicated to their basic obedience and the opportunity to play and exercise. Whether it’s hiking, walks or playing ball, Norris and Nicole are excited to spend time with you and have a place to call home.

Spayed/Neutered: Yes

name: Willow, Penguin
description:
Looking for TWO adorable dogs? We have the pair for you. 

Willow was found as a stray with her adorable puppies. Unfortunately one puppy did not make it but Penguin did! They love each other very much and need to be adopted together. 

They are both very sweet! Penguin is a typical puppy and Willow is a sweet and loving girl. Willow is house trained. Penguin is working very hard on potty training and basic potty training. They both need a family committed to continuing to work with them. 

If you are looking for a very sweet and loving pair- please consider giving Penguin and Willow a home!

name: Star Kay
description:
Best "fetcher" this side of the Mississippi!!!  https://youtu.be/D70Uxp6Rj90

Star raised three happy puppies and was a wonderful mom. It's now time for her to find her forever home. She is a sweet girl that bonds quickly and always wants to please. S She gets along with other dogs and adores children. 

She can play fetch for as long as you want, but then is content to come lay with you and watch tv. She spends alot of time in her foster moms lap watching movies. 

Star is an excellent girl that loves everyone. She came into the local animal control pregnant and was put in to foster care very quickly. She has been an awesome mom and has does a great job raising her 3 pups. Star is now ready to find her forever home.

She is house trained, but she does have a dog door so may need a little adjustment in her new home. She has great house manners and her foster mom says she has been one of the easiest fosters. 

Star doesn't meet a stranger and loves to socialize with people and other dogs. She loves to play fetch and can play as long as you are willing to throw the ball. Star loves to cuddle and doesn't realize that she is not a small dog. 

Watch Star in action:
https://youtu.be/PN-FLMrQNns
 
Name: Star	
Sex: Female
Breed: Labrador Mix
Age: 1 ½ as of 10/13/18
Weight: 46 pounds as of 10/13/18
Spayed/Neutered:Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative and on preventative
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Dogs: Yes. Star is living with 4 other dogs and is doing very well. She does very well with big and small dogs. 

Cats: No cats

Kids: Yes. Star has spent a lot of time with kids from 5 years old and up. She loves to sit and get loving from the kids. She can forget when she is excited and jump up on them, so supervision with small kids may be necessary.

name: Kingston Max
description:
Look at how handsome I am!!!!!!!!! 

I used to weigh 12 pounds, because my old owner just kept me in a cage all the time, now with a healthy diet and a yard to run in I am down to 8 pound!  My foster mommy is very proud of me.  

I am a little shy and timid at first.  I would like a quieter home, with or without other dogs.  If someone will give me time to warm up to them, I will cuddle and lay in your lap for as long as you will let me!  I am sporting a new hair cut and I have to say I am looking mighty dapper!  My mommy will get new pictures as soon as she can.

Please give me a great forever home! 


Name: Kingston Max
Breed: Papillon mix
Sex: Male
Age: 3-4 years old
Weight: 8 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative

name: Coral Cline
description:
Talk about GORGEOUS! Coral is a stunning terrier mix who is searching for her forever home. She was found as a stray and was in desperate need of love! She is now in an amazing foster home and is starting to blossom. 

Coral loves dog toys (balls & tug ropes especially), children (all ages), walks and SNUGGLING!  She loves belly rubs and attention from her humans, but is not “needy” or “clingy.”  She is content to entertain herself and is just as content to take a long nap on the couch with whomever she can round up!

She loves people and NEVER meets a stranger.  She is extremely outgoing and sociable!  Dogs, children, adults, cats – she loves them all!

We think that Coral might have a slight case of “body dysmorphia” (JUST JOKING!) because she thinks she’s a lap dog!  She loves to curl up in the nearest available lap like she’s a 10 pound poodle!  She can twist herself into a tight little ball and make herself look so small.

Coral would be so happy in a forever home with an active family (she’s very agile and loves to walk and run).  She needs a fenced back yard (or a fenced area) to exercise and use the bathroom.  She would also thrive in a home where children live because she is crazy about children and is very sweet and gentle with them.  She would also love a home with another dog friend or two if her “parents” work outside the home.

Coral is an amazing dog! Please consider adding her to your home today! 

Name: Coral Cline
Breed: Terrier mix
Sex: Female
Age: 1-2 years old
Weight: 32 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes- Coral is currently in a foster home with a 4 year old physically handicapped petite little girl, a 7 year old girl and a 13 year old girl.  She absolutely ADORES all of them! 

Good with Dogs: Yes- gets along great with other dogs!

Good with Cats: Yes- There are no cats in her current foster home, but Coral tested fine with a cat at the shelter and, when she goes for play dates at the neighbor’s house, she totally ignores the 2 inside cats.

name: Buddy Pal
description:
Quiet easy going boy: https://youtu.be/hcgET3acLeA

First, don't let Buddy's age scare you away - this boy is healthy as a horse and as active as can be!!!

Don't let Buddy's cuteness fool you!! Please take the time to read this and perhaps you know someone that would be a good match for this boy.

That's right, we're going to tell you right up front this boy has a troubled history of not loving some humans too much - he has a bite history - his prior owners are not exactly sure of the trigger but he's one of those dogs who lived a wonderful live with his owners so there's no explaining it - like some people he has an internal struggle going on. It doesn't mean a perfect home can't be found for him.

Buddy is approx. 10 years old - he had one owner his whole life - his mom - who spoiled him as she should and he was very attached - he was lucky in that his "uncle" took him in when she passed away. They've kept him for over a year and have done the best they can - they have grandchildren that visit often for long periods of time and people in and out of their house. This is too overwhelming for Buddy - he reacts unpredictably.

One of our partner vets knows this dog and family and referred them to us for help - with no absolute promises made we are going to try our hardest to find a home where he can be safe and be safe with others.

Perfect Home: Single person/couple or adult only home. Not a busy home - quiet - fenced yard where he can be outside. Leash walking - he's a pro - he can be a little reactive when strangers approach but is easily managed and is getting better.   

He's fostering now with other dogs - at first I wasn't sure he could live with another dog but i'm starting to think he would actually enjoy it - there's a few here that he actually plays with and one that he constantly hangs out with; he's not a fan of big dogs however.

Help us find a good situation for this boy - he looks at you like he loves you so much even though you just met him - he is a super cuddler with his human (even this new human he barely knows). Once he knows you, he's fine - a few quirks (i.e. doesn't like being picked up while sleeping).

If you're interested in learning more or know someone who is - please email: joannepawsne@gmail.com

He deserves a good home again. And he can be managed. And loved. And love right back.

Name: Buddy Pal
Breed: Havanese Mix
Sex: Male
Age: 10 year
Weight: 18
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negatove
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children:No
Good with Dogs:   Small dog in home would be okay but prefers to be only dog
Good with Cats: No, definitely no.

name: Haylie
description:
If you're you looking for a wonderful, fantastic, and all around great dog?! Haylie is the dog for you! 

Haylie is calm, quiet, well behaved, has soulful eyes and an easy going personality. She is very happy to finally be indoors out of the weather and immediately learned how to use the doggy door at her foster home.  She has not had any accidents indoors and keeps her bedding and space neat.  Haylie is thriving with her new routine and making progress with her leash training.  Her foster mom says that she is a joy to foster. 

Haylie would do best as an only dog or in a home with another calm, low energy dog.  Haylie has an old injury on her right rear leg that has healed but left her with some muscle atrophy.  She enjoys short walks but is not an active dog and has not shown interest in playing or running with the other dogs in her foster home.  Haylie is guarded about her injury and needs slow introduction to new dogs.  She currently has daily social time with other dogs and does well but does not enjoy high energy dogs who may approach her from behind and/or jump on her.   Haylie would be a perfect snuggle buddy.  She loves affection!

Haylie and her family were living on the property of a vacant home in rural Tennessee with a neighbor feeding them.  We don’t know how they survived but in September 2018 an amazing rescuer and Paws New England foster mom heard about them and took action. Haylie and her family are safe in foster homes now and will be ready for adoption in mid December.

We will update Haylie's profile as we find out more about her! Apply today if she looks like a perfect match for your home!  

Name: Haylie
Breed: Shepherd mix
Sex: Female
Age: 2-3 years old
Weight: 50 pounds as of 10/22/18
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped: Yes


BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:

name: Mama Boon Dog
description:
Look at this girl go - nothing's keeping her down!!!   https://youtu.be/2CYm3O_1Qko
This little lady came to Paws New England all the way from Guam!  One of our volunteers saw her story on Facebook and because she had experience with paralyzed dogs, she asked if we could help her.  The arrangements were made with her foster mom in Guam who rescued her and cared for and she arrived in September!!!

So far since being here, Mama has had an evaluation with Dr. Silver, a fantastic neurologist and with an MRI done, the short story is there is a very good chance this girl will walk again.  If you watch the video, she uses her hind legs rather consistently- it's felt with PT, water therapy and other supportive care, this could be life changing for her.

Mama is a doll - she is active, she gets along with the other dogs in her foster home, she loves the children in the home.  

She's is not incontinent and will tell you when she needs to get out - she's smaller than it appear so she's quite easily managed getting in and out of her chair - and let's hope this won't be forever.

Mama came to Paws New England with donations to help cover her physical therapy for some time and thus that support will continue after her adoption.

Consider adopting this girl and watch her get stronger and stronger! Won't it be amazing when you get to finally walk her on a leash???

If we haven’t won you over yet (really?), Michael also loves kids! Get your apps in for sweet Michael. He deserves the best forever home!

description:
AMAZING- that is the perfect description of Max! 

Max is a great dog and he is great with people. He loves everyone he meets! The only problem is that Max wants to be an only dog. He was surrendered to the shelter with his sister. His sister and Max were great buds but his sister got adopted and Max still has not. 

He is very happy and he is active! He would love an active family. He is working hard on basic obedience training and leash training- he is doing well. He is almost perfect on a leash now!

Please consider adoption this amazing guy! He promises to give you all his love in return! 
 
Name: Max Amazing
Breed: Akita mix 
Sex: Male
Age: 2 years old
Weight: 83 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date 
Heart worm: Negative 
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes- based on personality 
Good with Dogs: No
Good with Cats: No


Adoption Donation: 450.00

 
 
IMPORTANT INFORMATION:
Interested in a specific dog, please fill out an application if you are interested in a dog. The number of individual inquiries is overwhelming and we are finding it difficult to respond to each one. We cannot guarantee you will receive a timely response.
 
Paws New England is a rescue, not a shelter, and as such we do not have our dogs housed in one location - they are in foster homes both in New England and in our southern foster homes.   If you're interested in a specific dog, please complete a short online application and you will receive a reply within 48 hours so you can ask questions.
 
At present, if a dog is listed on our website, the dog is considered still available HOWEVER, may have applications that have come in before yours but it's still too early to know if any are a good match; therefore we encourage you to apply.
 

NOTICE WITH REGARD TO LOCATION OF DOGS:  Please note: Paws New England is a foster-based rescue. We do not have a brick and mortar building to house the dogs we rescue. We have found that dogs in foster homes are much more adoptable because they have been observed in a home setting. Dogs listed with Paws New England typically reside in various locations throughout the south (primarily Tennessee, Texas, and Arkansas) and New England (not necessarily in the state of Rhode Island). You will be notified by the adoption coordinator of the location of the dog you are interested in so you have the ability to decide whether to pursue adoption or not.

Dogs transported to New England are done so at a fee of $150.00 paid directly to the transporting company by Paws New England; no additional transport costs are responsibility of adopter. This fee is included in the adoption donation.

Adoption donations cover pre-adoption vet costs (including vaccinations, spay/neuter when age appropriate, and heartworm testing/treatment when necessary), a microchip, and transportation to New England if necessary.

Donations for our young, healthy puppies and dogs support their fellow canines of advanced age or suffering from injuries and abuse whose donations are reduced but whose veterinary costs are typically much higher. We appreciate your understanding that your dog will help others in need.

All known information about the animal is listed above. We do our best to give accurate information, but most of our dogs are rescues and do not come with a known history.

Paws New England abides by the dog importation regulations set forth in the states of MA, CT, NH and RI.

name: Macy
description:
Per-se-ver-ance: continued effort to do or achieve something despite difficulties, failure, or opposition.

Macy has had to display a huge amount of perseverance in her 2.5 years of age. Macy was found as a stray with her puppies. She went on to be an amazing mother to them however they became sick and only one of her puppies survived. Macy is now ready to find a family of her own! 

She is working hard with her foster family to learn basic obedience training. She is great on a leash and is potty trained! She gets along well with other dogs but does need to be fed alone as she really loves her food! 

Macy is so deserving of an amazing family- could you be it?!


Name: Macy
Breed: Shepard Mix
Sex: Female
Age: 2.5 years old 
Weight: 44 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: UTD as of 7/2
Microchipped: Will be before adoption

name: Millie
description:
Meet Millie!

Millie is the perfect family dog. She loves the company of anyone, even children! And she gets along with any dog she meets. 

She currently attends doggie daycare at John Gagnons Pet Resort and enjoys playing with the other pups all day long. 

She also lives with a high energy lab whom she loves to chase around the yard and play with from morning to night. 

Millie does require some puppy training, she is doing well with house training and crate training but not yet mastered. 

If you’re looking for the perfect addition to your family, Millie is the girl for you!

name: Gandhi
description:
The rescue of Gandhi is truly one that tugs greatly on the heartstrings. Foster mom named him Gandhi because it represents a man of peace, goodness and non-violence, everything that this sweet boy deserves in his life. 
 
Gandhi was found walking in circles in a hay field in the rural south.  Our local foster mom was told of him and she went to investigate. She found a young dog who was covered in scars to his body, face and eyes, most likely from a pellet gun.  It appeared that he was blind. He was immediately taken to the vet, where her her worse thoughts were confirmed.  He was covered in pellet wounds, including in both eyes. 
 
After an initial few days of rest, Gandhi had surgery to remove his left eye (the worse of the two) and to be neutered, which was seemingly already attempted in a most barbaric way.
He initially recovered in his southern foster home and now is local in New England.

FOSTER UPDATE 11/8/18:

Don't ask Gandhi about being blind, not sure he knows he is!  His zest for life is infectious (OK a couple of the senior dogs he's fostering with call it annoying ...) but he is the happiest dog ever.  He loves every person he meets and jumps up with an enthusiastic greeting to ensure you don't ignore him (working on that!).  He also loves every dog he meets, and can't understand why they wouldn't want to run, wrestle and play endlessly.  He's been in his new foster home for two weeks now, and has pretty much mastered the layout so the head-bumps are much less frequent.  

Gandhi loves to roam the house trying to find his people, his toys and the other dogs, but for safety reasons he is currently crated when his people are at work.  He "kennels up" when asked to and is becoming more and settled into his routine.  Dependent upon your home situation, this can be adjusted accordingly. 

Gandhi is house trained, a dream in the car and adores exploring the neighborhood. Such a joy to see this boy in action after such a tragic beginning. 

Get your applications in for our very special southern gentleman!  Please note that due to his blindness and playful nature, applicant should have at least another active playful dog in the household.

Questions?  email pawsjeanne@gmail.com

Name: Gandhi
Sex:  Male
Breed:  Lab/Shepherd
Age:  1-2 yrs.
Weight:  58 lbs.
Spayed/Neutered: Neutered
Vaccinations: UTD 10/3/18
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Yes
Special Needs: Blind, one eye removed as of now.
 
BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Dogs:  Yes, fostering with 8 and gets along with them all. Needs a playful canine companion. 
Cats:  No.
Kids: Not living with kids but based on personality, yes!

name: Atlas Atom
description:
Handsome Atlas - a super sweet boy whose 90 year old owner just couldn't care for him anymore - he's been very well cared for and loved so he has a lovely temperament.  We've moved him to one of our foster homes and foster mom said he's a very nice dog, getting along really well and doesn't seem too stressed with the move - Danes can be sensitive so we're glad he's doing well! Although Atlas is a senior dog, he is not a couch potato and is very active and playful.  He would love a fenced in yard to run in. 

More info as we get to know him but if you're considering a slightly older Dane for your home, don't wait- apply - we can get you all the info you need!!

Breed: Great Dane/Crossbreed
Sex: Male

name: Blaze
description:
Food Catcher? You got it: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bOomEwwyT6g&feature=youtu.be

Roll Over?  Yup: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IuYP4G2S-SI&feature=youtu.be

Want a rock star dog – here he is!!

This handsome (very handsome) red guy has recently undergone an evaluation with both Heather Gutshall of Outbound Hounds and Helen St. Pierre of No Monkey Business- both fantastic behaviorists and trainers. Both have said he’s a fantastic dog- he passed both temperament tests with flying colors.

Although Blaze has lived in a home with another dog, we feel that living as an only dog is what's best for him. Blaze loves his humans and would love to to devote 100% of his time to you!!

He’s such a big boy, we think small children might be intimidated by him, so we think children over the age of 12 would be appropriate.

Blaze is currently fostering in New England and his foster mom just adores him. He is not being crated in her home and he is a perfect gentleman. He is a sensitive, kissy face, marshmallow, love bug.  And thanks to his previous foster mom, he knows sit, stay, paw and rollover. He is a very good student and would love to learn more.

There is no question that he is a strong and powerful boy so we are looking for someone with breed experience. He is not the dog for a first-time dog owner.

He walks perfectly with his Gentle Leader, takes treats very gently and wants nothing more than to be loved (and to sit in your lap).

If you’re looking for a gorgeous, gorgeous representative of the bully breed family, this is your guy!

Breed: Pit Bull Terrier/Staffordshire Bull Terrier mix
Sex: Male
Age: 3 years old
Weight: 70 pounds
Heartworm: Negative
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped: Yes

name: Sundance
description:
Meet Sundance, a very handsome English setter mix.

Sundance was initially seen roaming around a roadway water basin in the rural south. One of our foster moms saw him following her van. When she pulled over and whistled, he jumped right into her van. We tried to find his owners to no avail! 

Sundance is quite mellow and easy going, but also very active and definitely has a hunting instinct for birds.  He could spend his entire day bird-watching. He has gotten along quite well with the dogs that he has met at his foster home, thus far. He is very smart, but does need some basic training- especially when it comes to recall. True to the breed, he is very inquisitive when outside. Leash training is going well and he needs a family that will continue to work with him.

Sundance is house trained with a doggie door and crates well at night, but he is excited to go first thing in the morning. He would do well in an active home with land to roam and exercise. He would also make a great hiking/running/walking partner. 

Interested?  Please submit an application or email dianegpawsne@aol.com for more info.


Name: Sundance
Sex:  Male
Breed:  English Setter Mix
Age:  2 years old
Weight:  48 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Dogs: Yes, has done well with dogs introduced to thus far.
Cats:Unknown, but he does appear to have a strong prey drive.
Kids: Based upon his temperament, he appears that he would do well with older children with proper introductions.

name: Max Maximus
description:
Adorable, cute, sweet, happy! Max is a happy 8 yr old papillon or maybe something else mix. His tail wags when you look at him or speak with him, and he does the happy dance when he knows he can go outside, though New England is a little cold for him right now, being very thin and coming from Texas. He will need a new wardrobe.  He is in rescue because his 94 year old mommy went to live in an assisted living home. He goes into his crate, is crate trained and doing well with house training. He is still working on leash skills and is a bit leash reactive and nervous meeting new dogs.. 

He loves to run in the yard and is great with other dogs, still learning how to play with other alpha dogs, as he was not socialized in his prior life. He made so much progress already. He seems to not be used to be a lapdog yet, but he loves Human attention. He loves to play with one of his new foster siblings in his current foster home, and enjoys his time with his new toys. He is quiet, and so, so gentle when he takes a treat. He walks good on the leash. He is a gem!

If you are looking for a new best friend- apply for Max! 

Check out his video! https://youtu.be/1t4zmpI8R-8

Sex: Male
Breed: Terrier mix
Age: 8 years old
Weight: 10 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: yes
Vaccinations: Up to date

name: Dolly
description:
“You go your way and I’ll go mine” is a quote that rings true with our sweet Dolly! You see our Broadway Star has limited vision and hearing but her eyes shine bright like the NYC lights. She loves attention like every actress and this one is crate trained. Potty training is also on her resume as well as getting along with other furry friends. We think Dolly would do well in a home with a supporting actor (aka another dog) and preferably older children due to her limited vision/hearing. We know Dolly is going to be a big hit this fall so submit those apps now before it is too late!
 
Check out her video! https://youtu.be/uuIMP09wb54
 
Name: Dolly
Breed: Cattle dog mix
Sex: Female
Age: approx. 2 years
Weight:  40 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: current as of August 2018
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: will be prior to transport
Medical: Dolly is hearing impaired and visually impaired. We think she can hear high pitched noises, but there is a chance she is totally deaf. Her vision is also impaired. She seems to be able to see objects straight in front of her, but she definitely has issues with her peripheral vision.
 

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Dogs: Yes, she is currently fostered with various different dogs and loves playing with them. Her best friend is Camellia also listed with PAWS New England.

Good with Cats: Yes, she is fine with the resident cat.

Good with Kids: Yes, she is not currently fostered with kids, but she has a gentle nature. As long as kids are aware of her special needs so older kids would be best.

name: Dozer DeWyte
description:
Hello there!  My name is Dozer!  I’m 1-2 years old and some say I’m the cutest pup they’ve ever seen.  I have short legs like a dachshund/basset and a head like a terrier.  The way I walk and prance around is very unique and my foster family thinks I’m very cute and funny.  My favorite thing to do is to play with my doggie friends.  I’m playful and happy but anxious about new things.  I need a home with at least 1 other happy, playful dog.  My new canine sibling should be confident because I get all of my cues from other dogs.  I like to play with people too!  I love when someone throws a toy for me and by the way, squeaky toys are the BEST!  

I am house trained and crate trained.  I’m sweet, playful, and snuggly.  I get excited and jumpy at times so I could benefit from basic training.  The great thing is that I’m food motivated and ready to learn.  

I can’t wait to find my forever home.  If you would like more info about me please email my foster mom  jen.pawsne@gmail.com or fill out a application.  Thanks!  

Love, Dozer

Name: Dozer DeWyte
Breed: Basset Hound/Pit Bull Terrier mix
Sex: Male
Age: 2 years 0 months
Weight: 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date

name: Clay
description:
Cute puppy alert!! Cute puppy alert! Look no farther- Clay is an adorable puppy and is looking for his forever family! 
Clay and his family were living on the property of a vacant home in rural Tennessee. We don’t know who was feeding them or how they survived but in September 2018 an amazing rescuer and Paws New England foster mom heard about them and took action. Clay and his family are safe in foster homes now and ready for adoption. 

Clay is smart and spunky.  He loves playing with other dogs and is doing great with his housetraining.

We will update Clay’s profile as we find out more about him! Apply today if he looks like a perfect match for your home! 

Check out Clay’s video!

name: Buddy Bear
description:
Meet your new fitness partner!

Buddy-Bear is a handsome 1-year old, Labrador Retriever / Cattle Dog Mix. He is currently living it up at his foster home, locally in New England, with his foster siblings (3 dogs, 2 cats) and gets along with them each of them well. It is in Buddy's best interest that he's placed in a family with at least one or two other K9-playmates. His foster parents have been working on basic commands and Buddy has been a wonderful student. We would like to see him continue training with his new family. He'll do best with a confident parent(s) who can provide both mental & physical stimulation while guiding him to make good choices!

Buddy still has that puppy energy and plays best in small groups (4-6 dogs) with fellow K9 friends similar to his size. On a warm, summer's day, he enjoys splashing around in the outdoor kiddie-pool. After a long, hard day of playing with friends, Buddy enjoys curling up by the TV for an evening of 'petflix' and cuddles. At the end of each night, he gets into his crate to re-charge for another full day of fun.

If you are looking for a fitness partner who will love you unconditionally, you have found your match!

Name: Buddy Bear
Breed: Heeler/Labrador Retriever mix
Sex: Male
Age: 7 months old as of 5/8/18
Weight: 33 pounds as of 5/8/18
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date in puppy series. May need additional vaccines at cost of the adopter. 
Heartworm: Too young to test. On preventative. 
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Would do best in an adult only home
Good with Dogs: Yes- would do best with a playmate!

name: Silka
description:
Now fostering in New England!! 


Five gorgeous, and we mean GORGEOUS, pups currently fostering in Texarkana but getting ready to make the big move to New England - we fully expect these creatures to fly off our website and be adopted in seconds so don't delay!!

Typical puppies, all are healthy, happy, and mischievous - so please, make sure you do your research before adopting a puppy - consider the free time you may no longer have, the expense of food, daycare if needed, training if you so decide and unexpected veterinary bills.

On the other hand, think about the joy you'll experience watching him/her grow and become your very best friend or your child(s) best friend; how much fun you'll have watching them try to get into trouble.  

A fantastic book to consider for puppy training!!!  Recommended by several behaviorists including a veterinarian behaviorist!   Available on Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/0964151871/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1

We are hopeful these little ones are ready to travel no later than 10/1 and hope to have homes finalized by that time.

Fallow (F); Brocket (M); Silka (F); Roe (M) Pudu (M)  - all named after deer species!

Breed: Beagle/Australian Shepherd
Sex: Female
Age:  14 weeks as of 9/20/2018
Weight: 20-25 lbs
Spayed/Neutered: No (too young, see below - spay/neuter contract will be required)
Vaccinations: Up to date in puppy series. 
Heartworm:  Too young to test
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes
Good with Dogs:   Yes

name: Flannery
description:
Hi, my given name is Flannery but I prefer Zoe! 

I just turned one on 10/27/18. It’s been a crazy first year for me. But I know things are going to turn around for me.

I live with my foster mom, 2 foster canine siblings, 3 feline siblings and 2 human boys. I LOVE all of them. My foster mom says, I have the sweetest temperament. I am potty trained. I do not like the crate. I love to go for rides in the car and long walks. I have a lot of energy, so I really like my walks but I need to be able to run around outside. So a fenced in yard is a must for me. Also, while I’m asking, I really want another friendly dog to play with and keep me company. I prefer someone who is home with me most of the time. 

I listen well, you don’t have to say “no” twice to me. I just want a forever family, a best friend, and someone who will never give me up. If you are still reading this far, and you have what I need, and you are kind and loving. 

Please apply for me. My foster mom can tell you everything about me. She says to me all the time, “Someone is going to get very lucky to have you!”

Name: Flannnery
Breed: Fox hound/Hound mix
Age: 1 year old
Weight:  38 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date 
Heartworm: Negative

name: Flounder
description:
Meet Flounder! 

This 9 pound bundle of cuteness was found hanging around the local auto parts store, we are not sure if he was looking to score a ride or a job.  Flounder had a large flea infestation when he was found so he is missing some fur, but we expect it to grow back without any issues.  

This young cutie was clearly a lap dog in his previous situation as he wants nothing more to than to climb on or be carried by people.  In his crate, he likes to talk to you to get your attention if you are working in the area and not paying attention to him. 
Flounder will walk on a leash for short periods of time, but mostly he just wants to climb on you for snuggles. 

UPDATE FROM FLOUNDER-10/15/18

Hi everybody! I am officially ready for my forever home. I need a house full of soft beds, people who like snuggles and yummy treats! I LOVE people but am a little nervous when I first meet men. I get along great with all of the dogs and people I have met here. I'm always happy and I love to play...with anything!   I'm really smart too.  I know how to sit and I've just about got this "going potty" thing down. I love attention. I could be your one and only or have other fur friends, just no cats because they are too fun to chase. 

If I sound like your kinda guy, please let PAWS NE you are interested and fill out an application!!  
Love,  
Flounder

name: Malaki
description:
Our little refugee Malaki  (pronounced Malakee) - from Amman Jordan arrived to Rhode Island and is doing really well!!!

We are currently in search of a forever home for this girl -  she has certain requirements not everyone may think they can handle - but you can.   We know it.

Her story is sad but we don't want to focus on that - let's focus on what she has to offer - love, affectionate, that amazing look she gives her current caretaker (you can see in video).  She's currently fostering in Rhode Island and her foster dad is madly in love.

Her prior caretaker in Jordan, Ahmad, r found her in the vet's office after she was found paralyzed.  

She currently wears diapers but is able to urinate on her own as well as defecate - but she can't get herself up so it will be a routine that will need to be established.

She currently lives with 4 other dogs and cats and is does well but honestly, we'd like to see her in a less chaotic home, perhaps with one other dogs, where someone can be devoted to her care.

She has had an MRI at Ocean State Veterinary - we had hoped there was something surgically that could be done but that's just not the case.  She won't walk again - she's being fitted for a custom wheelchair which of course will go with her wherever she goes.  The neurologist felt that PT or rehab therapy may not be  of much help to her as she doesn't seem to be in pain.

Here's a couple of videos so you can get a look at this adorably sweet girl.

https://youtu.be/s4L0N62idAo
https://youtu.be/dHv4vI8C3n8

Two weeks ago in Rhode Island 
https://pawsnewengland.com/our-dogs-list/malaki/


Any questions, please don't hesitate to email: joannepawsne@gmail.com

Name: Malaki
Breed: Canaan Dog (https://dogtime.com/dog-breeds/canaan-dog#/slide/1)
Sex: Female
Age: 2 years  approx.
Weight: 55
Spayed/Neutered: Yes

Sweetie is a Great Dane mix who is a perfect 91 pounds. She seems to get along with everyone she meets- children, dogs, cats, men, and women! As long as you have love to give so does she! She walks well on a leash and is housebroken AND crate trained! She also rides very well in a car and is just an overall quiet, obedient girl. 

Sweetie is a great dog and would love a family that will take her on walks and love on her!

name: Hippa
description:
Looking for a little love bug? Hippo is your girl! She was found by a good Samaritan and brought into one of our partner shelters with her sister where she is anxiously waiting to go forever home. Hippo is a little on the timid side. We would love to see Hippo in a home where she can learn that she can depend on and trust that her new family will take care of her and never leave her. 

We also believe Hippo needs to go to a home with another dog. She comes alive when her canine friends are around, and she likes to learn the ropes from them. 

It may take Hippo a little while to come out of her shell, but we promise you that if you’re patient with her that you’ll see her blossom into the most loving and grateful dog. 

Please get your applications in, Hippo is waiting for you!

description:
Mork, Mindy, and Fiona Ashdown are adorable puppies looking for forever homes! They were found after presumably bing dumped at a bot dock. Fiona was hit by a car but More and Mindy stayed right by her and they were all found and taken to rescue! Fiona did have to get surgery for her leg but she is recovering well! 

All three puppies are being well socialized in their foster home. They are your typical puppies and love to play and get attention! They are working hard on potty training and basic obedience training and will need a family committed to continuing working with them! 

If you have the time and energy to commit to a puppy- apply today!

name: DG
description:
This sweet unique girl is D.G. We believe that she is a Boxer/Dalmation mix. She is completely deaf. But don't let that fool you, she is super smart. She goes to a trainer for 3 days a week and stays where she has been learning sign language. So far she knows sit, stay, no, and come!!  All are still a work in progress and will need someone that is willing to continue working and practicing with her. (A video is in works of the signs being used.)

D.G. is great with other dogs. She is living with 4 and there are always different dogs at day care for her to play with. She does like to play rough, so will do best with dogs that are closer to her size. Because she can't hear, with new dogs it sometimes takes her a little bit to figure out their signals. If they are vocal with their signals, she can't hear them so it takes her a little bit. There are also cats roaming around the training/day care facility and she does awesome around the.

D.G. has been around kids of all ages and does great with them. She is a laid back girl for the most part and is happy hanging out or chasing a ball. She does get moments of zoomies, but they don't last long. She is great in her kennel and is doing great at learning house manners. She is house trained, but does have a dog door, so she will need time to adjust in her new home. 

Video of D.G. Playing https://youtu.be/QgrgQ_U2Mg8


Name: D.G.
Sex: Female
Breed: Boxer/Dalmation
Age: 1 years as of 08/24/18
Weight: 40 pounds as of 08/24/18
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date as of 08/24/18
Heartworm: Negative and on preventative
Microchipped: Yes
Medical: DG is completely deaf

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Dogs: Yes. D.G. Lives with 4 other dogs and goes several times a week to a trainers where she is around other dogs. She does very well with other dogs but does play rough. She may do best with a dog her own size with her rough play.

Cats: Yes D.G. Is not living with cats but there are 3 to 4 cats loose at the trainer/day care facility and she does very good with them.

Kids: YEs. DG does great with children


Adoption Donation: $250.00

description:
My name is Nila! I was found as a stray and now I cannot wait to find my forever home! I walk well on a leash, I’m good in my crate, and I’m working on potty training. My foster mom says I am very sweet and I love attention. I know how to sit for a treat. My favorite thing is to be with my human and getting lots of love and attention from my family.  I also LOVE toys and I love to run in my foster moms big yard.

name: Gracie Sunshine
description:
Sweet Gracie is sooooo ready to flood your life with sunshine!  She spent most of her life in a chicken coop until the day she made her escape and was rescued.  Lucky girl!  Now she’s learning all about air conditioning and soft beds and couches and doggie buddies and nice, attentive humans who want to shower her with love.  Being in a home with other well-loved and social dogs has helped tremendously! 

But she is taking these new steps gradually and is understandably cautious.  Gracie needs proper introductions with new dogs - she does fine with very brief initial interactions, but when they stay too close for too long, she gets nervous.  She is currently fostering with a large dog and has fostered with other dogs in the past – she has done fine with them with the proper slow introductions.  

Gracie is a true beagle and LOVES to follow her nose!  She will follow a scent trail as far as she can (so fun to watch!) and will try to chase small critters in motion, such as squirrels, birds, and cats. 

Gracie is a smart girl, eager to learn, and very food motivated!  She is house-broken and we’re now working on leash-training! 

If you think some beagle sunshine might be right for you, fill out an application to learn more about Gracie! 
 

Name: Gracie Good Girl Sunshine
Breed: Beagle mix
Sex: Female
Age: 7-8 years old
Weight: 24 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Will be before adoption 
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped: Will be before adoption 

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes- based on personality 
Good with Dogs: Yes- with proper introductions

name: Levi LoveMeDo, Reno AlwaysTrue
description:
NOW IN NEW ENGLAND!!

Levi and Reno are two ADORABLE beagle brothers looking for a new home.  The boys love each other very much and have always been together, and we’d like to keep it that way!  

Levi and Reno are 7 years old, and two years ago had the good fortune of being purchased by a hunting family that spoils their dogs!  For the past two years they have been very well loved and cared for.  Not long ago, their people had a change of heart and decided to stop hunting.  Instead of selling Levi and Reno to another hunter, they wanted to give them early retirement and a life of indoor leisure and love.  Sadly, their other indoor dogs were unwilling to share the couch, so the owners asked us if we could find a new home for them together.  We said sure! 

These boys are very affectionate, both with each other and with humans.  They'll jump up on their people to get attention, but are just as happy wrestling and rolling around with each other.   

They are true beagles and LOVE to follow their noses!  Such a kick to watch those tails and butts wiggle and wag as they follow a scent trail as far as they can!  

Both boys are quick learners and very food motivated!  It took Reno about 2.3 seconds to figure out the couch! HAH!  They are house-broken, love their playpen and will take you for a walk whenever you're ready  

If you’re ready for some LoveMeDo, Always True pupper love, get your application in now!   
Email pawsjeanne@gmail.com for more info.

Breed: Beagle mix
Sex: Male
Age: 7 years old
Weight: 28 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Yes

Name: Reno
Breed: Beagle mix
Sex: Male
Age: 7 years old
Weight: 25 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Yes

name: Lady Gilmore
description:
Shiny black coat of gorgeous fur - and bright white teeth - all make for one good looking canine.

This girl, no couch potato here - she wants to play, run, play, run - if you have another dog, she'd love it.  Bigger dogs - her size and up.  

She is a lover of all dogs but she's too much for small dogs and doesn't seem to get it so we think no small dogs in her home.  NO CATS for this girl!!!

Lady's foster mom tells us she walks pretty well on a leash and is housebroken - and she will go into her crate easily!  All nice attributes for a 4 legged!!

Another dog in the home would be fantastic but  if daycare was an option it would be great or of course someone active enough to keep her busy.

Happy to connect you with her foster if you're interested, all you have to do is ask!

Breed: Labrador Retriever Mix

name: Frannie
description:
FOSTERING IN NEW ENGLAND!!!!!
 

Frannie is a very sweet natured dog who is looking for a family to show her what being a family pet is all about! We know she deserves it!  She loves the couch and would love it if you would share it with her.  She is all ready for Halloween and loves dressing up in her caterpillar costume!
 
Frannie is shy, but she will let her trusted people pet her and pick her up-and she is gaining confidence every day.  She approaches new people cautiously but is curious and explores new things on her own terms. She loves to chase after toys or whatever else you can throw for her.  Play time is the best time!!!  And, run?  She loves to run.  Check out her video but after she gets her energy out, she can't wait to sit on the couch and cuddle up with you.
 
She loves other dogs and would be great in a home with another dog who can show her how many rubs she can get by being confident.  Frannie is looking for someone who understands that she will flourish if given time to acclimate to her new surroundings.

Check out this lovely girl:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/kp9w8fghr8bftz7/received_178401429724910.mp4?dl=0

name: Eula
description:
Meet Eula! 

A sweet, easy-going lab mix looking for her forever home! Eula is described as a happy go lucky dog who is content just hanging out and enjoying life with her people. 

Eula is great with other dogs and enjoys a playful session, but settles down nicely for quiet time too.

Eula putters around the yard sniffing and exploring and loves to sit in the sun.  She enjoys learning new things and getting cheered on for being such a good girl. She’s hoping to add some new tricks to her tool belt once she gets to her new home. Eula is so deserving of a family to love her forever. 

As with any puppy, dedication to training and obedience will be required.

Apply today to take her home!

Sex: Female

Spayed/Neutered: Yes

name: Captain Bridge
description:
"O Captain! my Captain! our fearful trip is done,"
Taken from O Captain! My Captain!  BY WALT WHITMAN


CAPTAIN LOOKING FOR A FOSTER OR ADOPTER ''

Captains and some friends!   https://youtu.be/Iz4kDQcKHi4

How about a  special project?   Captain Bridge would be a fantastic one!

Currently boarding at John Gagnon's Pet Resort​ in Connecticut, this guy is doing great with his new found friends!

Almost 5 years old, he had been in his adoptive home since a baby and they absolutely adore/adored him but the addition of a new baby who started crawling seems to have been an additional trigger to resource guardig (protecting what's his) and his lack of confidence.  They gave it their all but for Captain's sake and that of their little human, they painfully decided it was best for him to find a new home.  We wholeheartedly agreed with this decision.

Captain has  "resource guarding" behavior with other dogs. .   Evaluation by a professional showed zero aggression towards humans BUT children don't know what's his is his and we don't want any little fingers (or toes :)  ) getting nipped.so no children under 12 or so for this guy.  

An adult home with people willing to work on his confidence building would be superb and PNE will cover the expense of working with a behaviorist to attain this goal up to the amount of his requested donation - we will donate it right back to the person you choose to work with.

While he's working on resource guarding with his new family/foster, we think no dogs in the home although he can go to a daycare setting as you can see from the video.  Or someone experienced in this behavior with another dog would be fine.

Hope you'll consider this guy!  He's handsome, a great size for bigger dog lovers at 60 lbs, has had awesome vet care by his family so is healthy as a horse and is really a great dog.


Name: Captain
Age:  4 1/2 years
Weight: 60 lbs
Breed: Lab/Shep Mix (maybe some husky in there)
Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date 

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Other Dogs:  He does well in daycare with dogs - if dogs in his new home would need to be fed separately 
Cats:  Unknown
Kids: Yes

name: Mona
description:
Mona was picked up by animal control in June 2018 and gave birth to 6 beautiful pups on July 1st.  She was a very patient, caring, amazing mom!   Her puppies    have all been adopted and traveled north and now it's Mona's turn.   

Everything seems new to Mona.  She is happy to have a small space to call her own and takes good care of her bedding and toys.  

She has done well with every dog in her foster home.  She enjoys their company, and occasionally gives them kisses.  She loves toys and routinely selects new ones from the toy basket and takes them to her secret place.  She doesn't actually play with the toys but likes having them around.  When outside Mona likes to sit in the shade and watch what the other dogs are doing and observe the happenings in the yard.  

Mona is housebroken with a doggy door but is afraid to go outside during heavy rains and thunder storms.  She is still skiddish and shows signs that she may have been abused by running to her safe place if she hears loud noises or if a person has anything in their hands.   We are working on Mona's confidence and making progress.  She is no longer afraid of a leash and gets excited when it's time for her walk - especially if another dog is going walking with her.   

Mona is calm and well behaved but gets overly excited around cats. She is gentle when taking treats and loves affection.  She is still nervous when being held and is sometimes afraid to approach people.  

Mona would do best in a quiet home with another dog for her to bond with. Until she gains more confidence she should wear a harness while walking as she occasionally panics when hearing unfamiliar noises. 

Check out her video! https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=10211816115827976&id=1522178203


Name:  Mona
Sex:  Female
Breed:  Shepherd/Terrier mix 
Age:  5 years old
Weight:  34 pounds 
Spayed:  Yes
Vaccinations:  Up to date
Heartworm:  Negative
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with dogs:  Yes.  Has daily playtime with 2 large dogs and enjoys them. She does not seem to like small, high energy puppies other than her own.

name: Gucci, Coco
description:
Bonded duo now in New England! 

Have you been looking for a fashionable pair? Then this duo is for you! 

Gucci and Coco were found together in an abandoned building. They are very sweet girls who are bonded and truly love each other. Gucci is partially blind and relies on Coco for guidance and support. They both are very loving and want to please. They enjoy going on walks and hanging out around the house. 

These happy girls are so content together.  They don't mind if the other invades their food or water bowls, and it's perfectly OK if one wants to sleep in the other's bed - they share everything!  They are quiet, just don't try to keep them apart.  No.  Uh uh.  Never.  Not going to happen so don't even try.   

These ladies are great in the car, great with their 6 foster siblings, great meeting people on walks, all around gentle southern lasses.

If you have space in your heart and home for these sweet girls they will reward you with years of love! 
 
Want more info?  pawsjeanne@gmail.com

name: Mimi
description:
ex·u·ber·ant
adjective
filled with or characterized by a lively energy and excitement.
"giddily exuberant crowds"
synonyms: ebullient, buoyant, cheerful, jaunty, lighthearted, high-spirited, exhilarated, excited, elated, exultant, euphoric, 

See Mimi's story from start to almost finish (finish is when she's in her forever home) 
                         https://youtu.be/08q1ZqkCGcM

MIMI - big capital letters for a larger than life girl!!!  

She's arrived in New England and is a lively, exuberant  (hence the word above) pup who is enjoying life to its fullest thanks to her foster family and their canines who can't get enough of her.

Born with a defect that prevents her from extending her legs fully, she compensates by not worrying about it and running like MIMI should.  We will have her see an orthopedic surgeon at our wonderful friends at Cape Cod Veterinary Specialists to see if there's anything that can/should be done to help her with the deformity but for now she seems 100% happy as is - and so are we.


Name: Mimi
Breed: Terrier (maybe Pittie, maybe Jack Russell, maybe some lab)  Whatever the mix, she's perfect.
Sex: Female
Age: 1 year approx. (maybe less...bright white gorgeous teeth!!)
Weight: 32 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Yes
Medical: Deformity in her rear legs - recently had surgery to correct a Level 4 luxating patella in her rear leg.  Currently in recovery and doing fantastic.

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes- older children due to her physical limitations
Good with Dogs: Yes- gets along well with all other dogs! Mimi needs to be adopted into a home with another active dog.

name: Pambazo
description:
Although we don't always require a fenced yard and second dog in an adoptive home, for this boy we are - it's what is best for him- see below.

Pambazo is the definition of resilience and he is now looking for his forever home! 

Pambazo was originally found as a stray with an injury to his rear hips and legs.  Once we took him into rescue he was rushed to our friends at Memphis Specialty Vets and found to have several internal injuries and a "majorly" fractured leg - the x-rays are stunning.

He got through his critical stage and did really well postoperatively and off to his foster home he went where he's done very well with his rehab.  He's using the leg now and at this point he's just about ready for his new home.

Updated 10/24 from foster mom:
Pambazo is such a love in the house. A low-key playful smushy guy.  He is also quiet and kennel trained. Outside, he plays well with the other dogs and is submissive even.  Rides well in the car. He already knows "sit" and "down" and is in process of learning "shake" and to walk well on a leash. 

Pambazo can be timid when meeting new people, so he will do best with in a quieter home with a family that will continue to help with his socialization and confidence building skills. He would love to have a canine sibling. He is a great, handsome, smushy, loving dog who needs to learn to believe in himself! 

No small children due to his size and youth, plus he would want to chew their toys.

Would do best in a quieter home with family committed to meeting his needs

Fenced yard and canine sibling required for this boy!!  He loves to run, play, and wrestle and his shyness will make this difficult if there's no fence in the beginning stages of adoption.

Check out his video! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4cYzC-wTnLg

Breed: German Shepherd Dog mix
Sex: Male
Age: 2-3 years old
Weight: 55 pounds
Spayed/Neutered:Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes- he gets along well with everyone however due to his size he would be best with older children.

description:
Darla is a gorgeous brindle mutt who was found as a stray in the middle of nowhere. She is now with a foster family and starting to blossom! She does great with other dogs and has an extremely sweet personality. She is working hard on basic obedience training. She does have some separation anxiety but with a family committed to working on this with her she will do better. She cannot be left alone in the yard as she is quite the escape artist! She is moderately active and would do well inmost households. 

If you are looking for an amazing dog who will make a great companion then look no farther!
